intro: Navarretia leptotes, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open areas such as hillsides and meadows. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Navarretia leptotes is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in coastal and inland regions with a Mediterranean climate.
